body_html:
Great! Thanks for checking that out.

Maybe it would make sense to set preferred sizes of 640x480 for classification/detection and 1920x1080 for stylization, and have it fall back to the current logic only if they're not available.

Just to note, the only reason I have it pick the smallest sizes possible right now is to minimize CPU spent converting yuv->RGB and then rescaling. The actual frame size TF sees is always the same. The conversion is relatively fast, though, so doubling the number of pixels is not a huge cost.
